title: Human Resources Technician
description:
$5,179 - $6,296 a monthThe Human Resources Technician performs a variety of highly

responsible, confidential, and complex technical and

administrative support duties for the Human Resources

Department and provides support to the Human Resources

Manager and other staff. This class is distinguished from other

administrative and support staff by the performance of complex,

responsible, and sensitive duties related to the administration of

HR functions for the Citys 550+ employees. The incumbent

assigned to this class is expected to use judgment and discretion

in assisting employees/managers and to interpret and apply City

policies, laws, and regulations in response to requests for

information and assistance from employees and the general

public.


The Human Resources Technician will perform duties related to

recruiting, risk management, benefits administration,

performance evaluations/pay adjustments, and general human

resources administration. This position requires discretion to

work with confidential and sensitive issues on a regular basis.

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE

The City of Tracy is seeking an individual who is experienced in

administrative support with excellent interpersonal skills, the

ability to use sound judgment, a high level of sensitivity to

employee needs and is able to work cooperatively and

collaboratively with all City departments and the general public.

The ideal candidate will possess a high level of technical

expertise, strong interpersonal and communication skills, and

knowledge of public administration. Specific requirements for

this position are:


Additionally, the ideal candidate is able to:


 Understand and carry out oral and written directions; read,
comprehend, and interpret complex written material; work

effectively performing multiple tasks simultaneously.
Work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Excel in a team-oriented environment, seek input from
others, listen, and work well with a variety of groups.

Demonstrate strong customer service and organizational
skills.

Adhere to established division protocols
REQUIREMENTS


Education and Experience

The ideal candidate will have:
 

Equivalent to an Associates Degree from an accredited
college or university with major coursework in Business

Administration, Public Administration, or a related field.

Courses related to human resources management, are

highly desirable.
 
Three years of progressively responsible experience in
providing technical and administrative support duties

for the City of Tracy or three years of progressively

responsible experience in providing technical and

administrative support duties in the administration of

human resources programs including recruitment and

selection, benefit administration, risk management and

related human resources functions.
 
Previous public sector experience is desirable.
TYPICAL DUTIES
 
Provides assistance to City staff & public by telephone or

in person, regarding personnel matters by explaining

City personnel rules, regulations, policies & procedures

& Memorandums of Understanding; handles complaints,

and solves problems successfully in a manner that

creates positive outcomes.
 
Conducts orientation interviews with new employees
and employees with status changes; coordinates pre-
employment and other related medical examinations.
 
Compiles, organizes, & maintains a wide variety of
information associated with assigned personnel

functions; maintains personnel files & records; oversees

the division filing system.
 
Types memorandums, letters & reports, answers
telephones & schedules appointments; Independently

responds to letters and general correspondence of a

routine nature.
TYPICAL DUTIES CONTINUED
 

Conducts surveys and responds to requests from other
agencies; may assist with routine research and statistical

analysis, and assists in the preparation of reports,

manuals and policies.
 
Recognizes and respects the confidentiality of employee
information and issues handled by Human Resources.


COMPENSATION & BENEFITS
 
Retirement: CalPERS - (Formula is dependent on hire

date & member status in CalPERS)
 
Generous monthly Flexible Benefit Plan allowance to
assist with covering medical, dental, vision care, life

insurance.
 
Confidential Pay $50 per month
 

Vacation: 96 hours annually to start.
 
Sick Leave: 96 hours annually (unlimited accrual with
medical bank option upon retirement).
 

Employee Assistance Program.
 
Voluntary participation in a deferred compensation
account (ICMA or VALIC) up to 3% City match.
 

Employees may elect to enroll in a Section 125 Flexible
Benefit Reimbursement Accounts.
 

Tuition reimbursement.


THE SELECTION PROCESS

A limited number of applicants whose qualifications best meet

the needs of the City will be invited to participate in the selection

process, which may consist of a training and experience review

of application materials & Supplemental Question responses,

a written/computerized exam, an appraisal interview with a

panel, and/or other qualifying tests. Oral Board interview is

tentatively scheduled for December 12, 2018, with selection

interviews scheduled for December 18, 2018. The City

reserves the right to modify the selection process at any time.

Successful candidates will have their names placed on an

employment eligibility list for further consideration in the

selection process.


Appointment will be contingent upon the ability to provide proof of

eligibility to work in the United States and a thorough check of their

employment history.

HOW TO APPLY

RESUMES/FACSIMILES WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED IN LIEU OF

ORIGINAL CITY OF TRACY APPLICATION. POSTMARKS WILL

NOT BE ACCEPTED IN LIEU OF TIMELY FILING OF APPLICATION.

For more information, or to

Apply Online
Visit the Citys website at www.cityoftracy.org

Click on: Select an Online Service/Find Employment
Opportunities and then follow the instructions to submit

your application
To be considered for this opportunity, an official City of

Tracy application AND your responses to the

Supplemental Questions, must be received by Human

Resources Department no later than:

November 26, 2018 @ 12:00 PM


THE CITY OF TRACY IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
The City considers applicants without regard to race, color, religion,

ancestry, national origin, sex, marital status, age, medical condition or

disability, or any other status protected by law. The City seeks candidates

who can make contributions in an environment of cultural and ethnic

diversity. The City of Tracy makes reasonable accommodations for the

disabled. If candidates require special arrangements to participate in the

selection process, they should state their needs in writing when submitting

an application package.

description:

::

Strong clerical skills to include attention to detail, organization, proficiency, and productivity. Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and to develop and organized plan to efficiently process and follow through as necessary.
Strong computer application skills to include Word, Excel, and HRIS maintenance. Strong data entry skills.
Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and to develop an organized plan of processing and follow through.
Demonstrated knowledge of or aptitude for general HR knowledge to include, but not be limited to leave administration, employee relations, and general knowledge of employment law.

High School Diploma required.

title: Human Resources (HR) Assistant
description:
Human Resources (HR) Assistant

We are hospitals and affiliated medical groups, working closely together for the benefit of every person who comes to us for care. We build comprehensive networks of quality healthcare services that are designed to offer our patients highly coordinated, personalized care and help them live healthier lives. Through collaboration, we strive to provide all of our patients and medical group members with the quality, affordable healthcare they need and deserve.

The Human Resources (HR) Assistant promotes, fosters and maintains customer satisfaction through friendly, effective and efficient handling of customer needs in person and on phone. Inputs various data into tracking systems. Supports employment process by reviewing applications, providing information on openings, scheduling appointments and physicals, maintaining forms and document supplies, following up on issues, submitting background checks, filing and handling correspondences.

Job Responsibilities/Duties

Provides the highest level of service in greeting and assisting internal and external customers.
Reviews applications for completeness and communicates interview process.
Demonstrates excellent communication skills on the telephone and answers within 3 rings.
Is self-directed in assessing strengths and weaknesses and in identifying career and self-development activities.
Develops solutions to departmental problems.
Identifies and/or implements methods of controlling cost or generating revenue while providing maximum value to both the patient/customer and the department/Hospital.
Responsible for maintaining and filing all documents; organizes file room.
Timely logs applications and resumes in log book. Photocopies and distributes applications to appropriate departments.
Assist with meal ticket program.
Responsible for filing current licensure and certifications in employee files.
Processes subpoenas for employee records, assuring collection of accurate information, as well as appropriateness/legality of subpoenas.
Handles employment verification requests.
Sorts and distributes mail to and from the department. Distributes weekly employment opportunity list.
Assists Employee Transportation Coordinator with processing rideshare rewards, assisting in annual surveys and rideshare plans.
Schedules physicals for employee health appointments.
Prepares New Hire Packets and Benefit Packets. Order benefit materials as needed.
Ensures coverage of front desk during all work hours.
Maintains Form Centers in Human Resources.
Performs other related duties as assigned.


Qualifications

Minimum Education: High School Diploma or equivalent. AA Degree preferred in Human Services, General Business or equivalent.

Minimum Experience: Two (2) years office experience, preferably in HR or healthcare facility. Must have strong organization, word processing and data entry skills. Must be able to demonstrate excellent customer service and effective communication skills.

Req. Certification/Licensure: None.

Employee Value Proposition

Prospect Medical Holdings, Inc., is guided by a diverse and highly experienced leadership core. This group maintains the vision that has made Prospect a needed difference-maker in the lives of so many patients today, and many executives contribute to our continued efforts. As a member of our highly effective team of professionals you will receive:

Company 401K
Medical, dental, vision insurance
Paid time-off
Life insurance



How to Apply

To apply for this role, or search our other openings, please visit http://pmh.com/careers/ and click on a location to begin your journey to a new career with us!

We are an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status, disability, race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or other protected characteristics. If you need special accommodation for the application process, please contact Human Resources.

title: Human Resources Analyst
description:
$6,965 - $9,137 a monthHuman Resources Analyst
#394
San Bernardino, CA
FUNCTIONAL GROUP: Confidential
FULL-TIME/PART-TIME: Full-time
LOCATION CODE: SBCCD Central Services-00003
Posting Closing Date Sep 21, 2018
Work Schedule Monday-Friday 8am-5pm
Job Description
SUMMARY DESCRIPTION:
Under the direction of the appropriate administrator, Human Resources Analyst performs analytical and specialized functions to support the administration of comprehensive human resources and employer/employee relations programs for academic and classified employees; performs related duties as required.
The Human Resources Analyst is the senior classification among support staff positions in the Human Resources Office. Performance of duties requires in-depth knowledge of the organizational structure, risk management, employee safety training programs, District policies, regulations, procedures, union contract provisions, human resources and employer-employee relations processes and practices, legal affairs, resource utilization; worker's compensation, exercise of discretion, and maintenance of confidentiality. Incumbents are assigned a major responsibility in either human resources management or employer-employee relations work, but may be required to perform duties in the alternate area.
The current vacancy will focus on health benefits administration. and leaves of absence administration for the district.
Duties related to health benefits administration includes but not limited to: conducting health benefits workshops, facilitating open enrollment period, coordinating employee health fairs, maintaining and entering data into health benefits eligibility system(s), escalated point of contact for carrier issues, reconciling monthly invoices, and enrolling new hires.
Duties related to leave of absence administration include but not limited to: providing information and to employees and determining employee eligibility on various types of federal, state and collective bargaining agreement leave of absence protections including Family Medical Leave Act (FMLA), California Family Rights Act (CFRA) and Pregnancy Disability Leave (PDL). Tracking of employee leaves and coordinating leaves with Payroll department and employee's supervisor.
REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES:
The following duties are typical for this classification:
1. Provides administrative support in collective bargaining negotiations, contract interpretation, researches, develops, costs-out and analyzes issues and proposals related to the collective bargaining process, participates in collective bargaining negotiation sessions and strategy meetings.
2. Manages the Human Resources Office Records Retention Program, updates and maintains the District's Classification and Compensation Plan.
3. Assists in the review of laws and regulations pertaining to human resources and labor relations activities.
4. Analyzes project costs, and reports effect of proposed and/or established employee contract provisions, policies, programs and activities.
5. Assists in training managers and supervisors in contract implementation, including grievance and disciplinary processes and procedures.
6. Assists in the investigation and response to grievances, unfair labor practice charges, unlawful discrimination claims, and conflict resolution.
7. Facilitates implementation of disciplinary processes, including monitoring timelines and procedures.
8. Monitors processes, timelines, and facilitates work related to employer-employee relations.
9. Coordinates and maintains liability claims administration programs, and acts as liaison with third-party administrators.
10. Monitors due dates, compiles and reports data for State collective bargaining mandated cost reimbursement.
11. Analyzes and explains District policies, contracts, and other regulations.
12. Assists in hiring, representing the Human Resources functions, including participating in employment interviews, conducting pre-employment reference inquiries, orientation, and training processes for new employees.
13. Trains and/or arranges for departmental staff training.
14. Assists in planning and implementing management training and staff development programs.
15. Analyzes jobs, conducts job classification and compensation studies.
16. Drafts policies and procedures.
17. Assists in the administration of salary and benefit programs.
18. Facilitates and coordinates the HRIS programs.
19. Assists in reporting data for Management Information System (MIS).
20. Coordinates faculty and staff diversity programs and regulations, including training representatives and advising selection committees of equal employment.
21. Develops salary, benefit, budget, and other statistical data.
22. Utilizes software programs and recommends modifications conducive to increased efficiency.
23. Communicates effectively orally and in writing.
24. Carries out oral and written direction.
25. Demonstrates a sensitivity to and understanding of the diverse academic, socioeconomic, cultural, and ethnic backgrounds of staff and students and of staff and students with physical and learning disabilities.
26. Performs other related duties as required.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING ENVIRONMENT:
The conditions herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.
Environment: Work is performed primarily in a standard office setting.
Physical: Primary functions require sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in an office setting; to stand or sit for prolonged periods of time; to occasionally stoop, bend, kneel, crouch, reach, and twist; to lift, carry, push, and/or pull light to moderate amounts of weight; to operate office equipment requiring repetitive hand movement and fine coordination including use of a computer keyboard; and to verbally communicate to exchange information.
Vision: See in the normal visual range with or without correction; vision sufficient to read computer screens and printed documents; and to operate assigned equipment.
Hearing: Hear in the normal audio range with or without correction.
Requirements
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education and Experience Guidelines: A typical way to obtain knowledge and abilities would be:
Education/Training:
A Bachelor's degree in public administration, human resources, business administration, paralegal studies or related field. *Completion of at least sixty (60) college-level semester units and six years of human resources administration experience can be used in the absence of a bachelor's degree.

Experience:
Four years of professional experience with increasingly responsibilities in human resources management, employer-employee relations, risk management, basic workers' compensation, including classification compensation benefits, or similar programs involving regulatory processes and procedures.

Unofficial transcripts must be submitted with application. Copies of diploma will not be accepted.

Experience must be indicated in the application. Resumes will not be used for screening of minimum qualifications.

Desirable Qualifications:
Experience in a public agency preferably in the California Community College system.

Special Condition:
Positions in this classification may be required to work varied hours according to need.

Other Employment Requirements:
Live Scan and Proof of Tuberculosis clearance required for employment at employee expense.

The following generally describes the knowledge and ability required to enter the job and/or be learned within a short period of time in order to successfully perform the assigned duties.

Knowledge of:
Human Resources and/or employer-employee relations programs and processes.
Current relevant federal and state laws and regulations related to Human Resources.
Laws and regulations related to risk management, loss control, workers' compensation programs and workplace safety issues.
Information sources and resource materials available to California Community Colleges.
Arithmetic to compute salary, benefit, and budget data.
Collection and organization of data.
Equal Employment Opportunity guidelines.
Research methodologies appropriate for human resources functions.
Job analysis methodologies and application.
English, grammar, spelling, and punctuation.

REQUIRED Supporting Documents:
Cover Letter
Resume
Unofficial Transcripts

APPLICATIONS SUBMITTED WITHOUT THE REQUIRED SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS WILL BE DEEMED INCOMPLETE AND NOT FORWARDED FOR CONSIDERATION


APPLICATION DEADLINE: FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 21, 2018 2:00 PM (PST)

Salary and Benefit Information
Salary Range is from $6,965.21 to $9,137.25 per month plus family medical, dental, vision coverage, and employee life insurance (employee contribution dependent upon plan selected). PERS Retirement.

title: HUMAN RESOURCES SPECIALIST-Human Resources
description:
The ancestors of the Sycuan Band of the Kumeyaay Nation existed many centuries ago as a community of peoplea Tribe living together, farming, hunting and fishing to survive.

Much has changed since that time. Today the Sycuan Tribe governs its Reservation, owns and operates a Casino and a Golf Resort, and owns a number of other business ventures in the San Diego Region.

One attribute that remains unchanged, however, is Sycuan's sense of community. Sycuan is more than just a business. Sycuan is a community of people working together toward a common goal. Whether you work in our state-of-the-art Casino, our beautiful Resort, or become a staff member in our Tribal Government division, you will be part of the Sycuan family.
Job Purpose:

Provides Human Resources guidance and support to assigned Casino, Tribal, Resort, and Hotel departments

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
(Note: Duties and responsibilities may be added, deleted, or changed at the sole discretion of Sycuan Management at any time)
Provides Human Resources support to assigned departments by building relationships and collaborating with department heads, determining needs and challenges to effectively assist in resolving performance management and disciplinary issues, and providing training and guidance to new supervisors and managers on established Human Resources policies and procedures, HRIS, and Performance Management systems. - 25%
Ensures paperwork is accurate and in compliance with legal requirements and company policy by advising managers and supervisors on proper and legal application of Human Resources policies and procedures, reviewing performance appraisals and progressive discipline documents for proper completion, initiating corrective action as needed, reviewing termination paperwork for content, clarity and compliance, and providing guidance and direction to Managers on effective use of language in written documents. - 25%

title: Human Resources Administrator
description:
Desired: Professional In Human ResourcesChristian Wheeler Engineering is looking to fill a central role to our team!

CWE is an independent, locally owned and operated firm that provides geotechnical consulting, construction observation, special inspection and materials testing services. Our staff is just under 50 fantastic employees and we're looking for a very hands-on team player to help manage a multitude of duties. CWE is a place that hires great people and maintains a low turnover rate. Excellent benefits package and a great work-life balance culture comes included!

Your duties will include (but not be limited to) the following:

Recruit, screen, interview and hire to fill various job openings. Handle new hire paperwork, orientation and training.

Partner and consult with management regarding human resources policies, procedures, best practices, laws and regulations. Review employee handbook at least annually and update as needed.

Handle employee relations issues including internal and external employment-related complaints; work with managers/supervisors on disciplinary actions and terminations. Investigate discrimination or harassment complaints.

Notify and work with insurance company and attorney, when necessary.

Process voluntary and involuntary employment terminations ensuring compliance with applicable laws, adequate documentation, return of company property, payment of wages and expenses and appropriate processing of benefit terminations.

Manage worker leaves of absence with appropriate documentation and return to work authorization.

Respond to notices and inquiries from EDD; represent the company in unemployment claims hearings.

Facilitate and/or provide training for employees as needed.

Work with benefits broker and plan service providers to manage all aspects of employee benefit administration including renewals, open/special enrollments, billing reconciliations, required notices, changes, and COBRA.

Manage safety program and facilitate safety committee. Ensure compliance with state and federal workplace safety laws including record keeping, reporting, IIP Program, CalOSHA, and Safety Data Sheets. Manage workers compensation claims with insurance company. Review safety manual annually and update as needed.

Manage business insurance program. Prepare documents and information needed for annual renewal, request

certificates of insurance as needed, and facilitate reporting and resolution of claims.

Track and manage fleet vehicle activities including purchase and disposal of vehicles, tracking condition, coordinating repairs and maintenance, preparing reports, and maintaining lists of insured drivers and vehicles.

Manage service vendors including IT support, printer/copier contracts, phone and internet service providers, etc.

Manage administrative staff ensuring all administrative activities are handled efficiently and effectively.

Maintain small business certification, prevailing wage registration, required vendor licensing, etc.

Update company website including job postings, projects, and other news or information.

REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelors degree; 4-6 years of experience in human resources and office administration; or an equivalent combination of education and experience. PHR Certification preferred but not required.

Current knowledge of federal and California employment-related laws and regulations including FLSA, DLSE, DIR, DFEH, COBRA, ERISA, OSHA, Cal-OSHA, and prevailing wage laws.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize.

Possession of computer skills to include Word/Excel/Access/Outlook. Ajera knowledge a plus.

Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills. Proofreading/copyediting skills a plus.

Ability to work independently on assigned tasks as well as the ability to accept direction.

Able to work cooperatively with management, co-workers, and employees.

This job description is not intended to describe, in detail, all the tasks that may be required but rather to give a general sense of the responsibilities and expectations of the position. As business demands change so, too, will the essential functions of this position.

WORK ENVIRONMENT/WORKING CONDITIONS:

Frequently involves sitting, grasping, fingering, lifting, bending, twisting, reaching, talking, hearing, and repetitive motion. Frequently requires lifting and carrying up to 10 pounds; may occasionally require lifting up to 20 pounds. Occasionally involves standing, stooping, crouching, and kneeling. Work environment is an office with some exposure to dust from adjacent lab area.

description:

Do you have experience in benefits administration with strong HRIS skills? Or maybe you are an adaptable individual who enjoys a fast-paced, interactive environment in Benefits and Recruitment? We have two positions that will fit both types and are looking for smart, hardworking, and organized human resources professionals. Check out this opportunity!

Employee Recruitment and Benefits Unit (Position Codes 0056 and 1018)

Duties:
There are two HR Technician positions available! One will be solely supporting our amazing Benefits team with a focus on HRIS responsibilities, while the second position will work with both the Benefits team and our awesome Recruitment team.

In the Benefits function, this person will be assisting with the HRIS responsibilities (calculating, processing and inputting employee payroll transactions for bi-weekly data entry), processing new hires and separations/retirements. They will also be assisting the Benefits team with various clerical tasks (preparation of new hire orientations, support of Wellness Program activities and events, organizing, copying, and filing of documents & employee records) while also providing customer service to employees, managers and retirees who contact Benefits via phone calls, emails and/or walk-ins.

In the split role, Recruitment will also be a main focus supporting all recruitment functions (working within the applicant tracking system, answering inquiries and providing customer service to applicants, providing support to Recruiters in posting, sourcing, scheduling and setting up interviews, and file management). In addition, responsibilities will include supporting the outstanding Internship Program. Proficiency in scheduling in Outlook and all functions of MS Office plus Applicant Tracking System experience is preferred. Ability to multi-task, anticipate needs and complete tasks while providing exceptional customer service is key. Running reports, compiling/verifying data and ensuring data integrity will also be an integral part of this role.

Running reports, compiling/verifying data and ensuring data integrity will also be an integral part of both roles.

Applicants whose experience and background best match the ideal experience, knowledge, skills, abilities and education are considered ideal candidates for the position. To determine the top candidates, each applicant will be assessed based on the ideal candidate criteria as listed below.

Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing.
Organizational and problem-solving skills, with proven research capabilities.
Excellent judgment in responding to benefits and/or recruitment related requests.
Tech savvy with demonstrated ability to maintain accurate records with impeccable attention to detail.
Must have exceptional customer service skills and be a team player willing to assist wherever there is a need.
Functionality and uses of HRIS and applicant tracking systems, recruiting and sourcing methods, including social media-oriented skills, interview scheduling and screening of applicants.
Adaptability when dealing with varying situations, with the ability to develop strong working/professional relationships with managers, staff throughout the District, potential applicants and candidates.
Proficient in MS Office Skills (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive matters, exercising considerable judgment, discretion, and professionalism.
Knowledge of HRIS databases, recruitment and selection practices and principles, Human Resources and Payroll principles, pertinent labor laws and exposure to MOUs is ideal.
Ideal Training and Education:
Three (3) years of experience completing human resource transactions involving databases and/or administering human resource programs, such as benefits administration, payroll processing and recruitment.
HR certifications are highly desirable.A practical exercise may be a part of the interview process
License or Certificate

Possession of, or ability to obtain, an appropriate, valid California driver's license. Individuals who do not meet the driver's license requirement due to a disability will be considered for a reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

title: Human Resources Assistant
description:
St. Luke's is proud of the skills, experience and compassion of its employees. The employees of St. Luke's are our most valuable asset! Individually and together, our employees are dedicated to satisfying the mission of our organization which is an unwavering commitment to excellence as we care for the sick and injured; educate physicians, nurses and other health care providers; and improve access to care in the communities we serve, regardless of a patient's ability to pay for health care.
The Human Resources Assistant supports the Human Resources Department by performing various administrative functions and assisting with special projects. Provides appropriate information and excellent customer service to both internal and external customers of the department. The Human Resources Assistant also supports the HR Director and the HR Specialist. In this role, he/she interacts with all levels of the organization and the Network.

JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Provides administrative support for the Human Resources Department, as well as back up administrative support to the Monroe Campus Administration.
2. Assists with recruitment and new hire process by providing a variety of administrative functions.
3. Tracks compliance of new hires and transfers and maintains data on the Recruitment Compliance log. Maintains and monitors to ensure documents are submitted and clearances are received in a timely manner to meet requirements. Contacts employees with reminders on clearance deadlines.
4. Assists recruitment with new hire process. Runs and submits all necessary criminal background checks and other necessary pre-employment clearances. Provides timely follow up to HR Director regarding any employees who are not in compliance.
5. Tracks and maintains the license verification process for Registered Nurses.
6. Handles pre-hire reference checks and employment verifications in accordance with Network policy.
7. Maintains employee personnel files as well as other department filing.
8. Provides various administrative support to the department, such as meeting scheduling, mailings, letter preparation, distributions, etc.
9. Coordinates various employee recognition programs
10. Compiles and distributes monthly campus newsletter.
11. Handles the employee photo identification badge process and maintains camera and photo supplies.
12. Works with managers to keep job descriptions updated and uploaded to policies and procedures on MyNet.
13. Responds to general employee inquiries related to benefits, recruitment, employee policies and employee relations.
14. Enters new volunteer data in the Volgistics' system. Maintains volunteer profile data and updates data periodically to ensure compliance. Handles inquiries from potential volunteers as well as general questions from current volunteers.
15. Provides excellent customer service to Network employees, visitors and volunteers.
16. Coordinates and assists with implementation of special projects/events for employees and/or the Monroe Campus.
17. Interacts with all levels of Network Human Resources personnel.
18. Handles Workers' Compensation including compiling and submitting all first reports of injury to the workmen's' compensation carrier, answering employee/managers' questions, coordinating with workmen's' compensation carrier to update status on claims Maintains OSHA records.
19. Analyzes WC claims data and assures reporting accuracy, reports trends to the Safely Committee at monthly meetings. Works closely with Safety Coordinator regarding safety training and in-services, accident investigations, regulatory compliance, quality assessment and safety promotion related to Hospital employees.
Maintains confidentiality of all materials handled within the Network/Entity as well as the proper release of information.
20. Complies with network and department policies regarding issues of employee, patient and environmental safety and follows appropriate reporting requirements.
21.Demonstrates/models the Networks Service Excellence Standards of Performance in interactions with all customers (internal and external).
22.Demonstrates Performance Improvement in the following areas as appropriate: Clinical Care/Outcomes, Customer/Service Improvement, Operational System/Process and Safety.
23. Demonstrates financial responsibility and accountability through the effective and efficient use of resources in daily procedures, processes and practices.
24.Complies with Network and departmental policies regarding attendance and dress code.
25.Other related duties as assigned.
26.Must have the ability to handle multiple projects/issues at one time while maintaining a customer focus.

PHYSICAL AND SENSORY REQUIREMENTS:

Sitting for up to six hours per day, one hour at a time. Standing for up to five hours per day, one hour at a time. Walking up to three hours per day, thirty minutes at a time. Fingering and handling frequently. Twisting and turning of hands occasionally. Lifting and carrying up to ten pounds occasionally. Pushing and pulling up to 50 lbs. occasionally. Occasionally stoops, bends, squats, kneels, and reaches above shoulder level. Hearing as it relates to normal conversation. Seeing as it relates to general, near and visual monotony.

EDUCATION:
High school graduate or equivalent. Additional secretarial/business courses preferred.

TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE:
Minimum of two (2) years secretarial experience in a busy customer service environment, preferably in a hospital and/or Human Resources department. Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Outlook required.

Additionally, you are encouraged to upload a current resume, including all work history, education, and/or certifications and licenses, if applicable. It is highly recommended that you create a profile at the conclusion of submitting your first application. Thank you for your interest in St. Luke's!!

Providing Opportunity, Assistance and Care for Arizonans in need!

ARIZONA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (AMS):
All Arizona state employees operate within the Arizona Management System (AMS), an intentional, results-driven approach for doing the work of state government whereby every employee reflects on performance, reduces waste, and commits to continuous improvement with sustainable progress. Through AMS, every state employee seeks to understand customer needs, identify problems, improve processes, and measure results. Office of the Director
1789 W. Jefferson Street
Phoenix, AZ 85007
www.azdes.gov

JOB SUMMARY:
Under the direction of the Human Resources Manager, this position provides general Human Resources administrative support to the areas of recruitment, personnel action requests and classification/compensation.

 Writes job announcements and creates new requisitions in applicant tracking system. Screens resumes against requirements of the position; prepares hire lists and forwards to hiring manager. Coordinates candidate interviews; conducts reference and background checks and prepares new hire packets. Verifies completion of pre-employment actions and imports documents into OnBase system.  In-state travel may be required. This position requires possession of and ability to retain a current, valid state-issued driver's license appropriate to the assignment. title: Human Resources Assistant
description:
Crystal Creamery is currently looking for a Human Resources Assistant in our Modesto Office.

Position Description:
The Human Resources assistant assists with the administration of the day-to-day operations of the human resources functions and duties. The HR assistant carries out responsibilities in some or all of the following functional areas: departmental development, HRIS, employee relations, training and development, benefits, compensation, organization development, executive administration, and employment.

The HR assistant has partial responsibility for these areas:

recruiting and staffing logistics;
employee orientation, development, and training logistics and recordkeeping;
assisting with employee relations;
company employee communication;
compensation and benefits administration and recordkeeping;
maintaining employee files and the HR filing system;
Assisting with the day-to-day efficient operation of the HR office.
The Human Resources assistant contributes to the accomplishment of Human Resources practices and objectives that will provide an employee-oriented, high-performance culture that emphasizes empowerment, quality, productivity and standards, goal attainment, and the recruitment and ongoing development of a superior workforce.

The Human Resources assistant helps with the implementation of services, policies, and programs through HR staff. The HR assistant also reports to the HR Manager who the assistant helps to fulfill their responsibilities. The HR assistant also assists company managers with HR issues.

Primary Objectives:
Safety of the workforce.
Development of a superior workforce.
Development of the Human Resources department.
Development of an employee-oriented company culture that emphasizes quality, continuous improvement, and high performance.
Personal ongoing development.
The key areas for which a typical HR Assistant is responsible are highlighted here as well as more specific tasks in each area of responsibility.

Development of the Human Resources Department
Administers programs, procedures, and guidelines to help align the workforce with the strategic goals of the company.
Participates in developing department goals, objectives, and systems.
Prepares and maintains reports that are necessary to carry out the functions of the Human Resources department. Prepares periodic reports for management, as necessary or requested.
Participates in administrative staff meetings and attends other meetings and seminars as necessary and to represent the department.
Employment
Advertises employee job openings first, internally, and then, externally, in keeping with company recruitment policies. Manages the logistics of the recruiting process.
Writes newspaper classified ads and posts ads on the Internet in places appropriate to the open position including job boards, college career services offices, professional associations, and on the company's website.
Sorts and reviews resumes as they arrive on a daily basis. Manages the flow of paper applications and manages the recruiting email box. Provides the first review of resumes. Maintains a filing system that retains qualified applications for one year.
Schedules interviews for the hiring manager and Human Resources. Schedules additional interviews as needed.
Conducts new employee orientation.
Prepares paperwork required for new hires and establishes personnel file.
Executive Administration
Sorts mail and faxes; distributes to employee mailboxes.
Assists with Board of Directors meetings: creates board packets, meets and greets arriving board members, orders lunches, makes reservations.
Consolidates and emails out weekly management reports to managers.
To perform the Human Resources Assistant job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential responsibility satisfactorily. These requirements are representative, but not all-inclusive, of the knowledge, skill, and ability required of the company Human Resources Assistant.

Human Resources Assistant Requirements
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

Excellent computer skills, including Word and Excel in a Microsoft Windows environment.
Effective oral and written communication skills.
General knowledge of various employment laws and practices.
Experience in administration of benefits and other HR programs.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Skills in database management and record keeping.
Able to exhibit a high level of confidentiality.
Excellent organizational skills.
Must be able to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner.
Must be able to gather and analyze information skillfully.
Education and Experience
A Bachelor's Degree is required.
One to two years of general business experience, Human Resources experience preferred.
To apply please visit www.crystalcreamery.com click on careers and job openings.

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
Human Resources Generalist - DEN000256
About Us
Danaher's Dental Platform is a $3B global business focused on all aspects of dental care. With the intention to spin-off the Dental Platform to become its own public company in the second half of 2019, Dental Co will become one of the largest and most innovative dental companies in the world. We are changing the face of dentistry with our differentiated portfolio of products designed to serve every dental professionals need. It is our mission to make our dentist's work simpler and better connected so more patients are cared for in a shorter time. Our dental brands include traditional consumables and equipment (KaVo Kerr) and specialty products (Ormco and Nobel Biocare).
Description
The HR Generalist will provide support to associates and managers in the handling of all human resource related activities which may include: employee relations, fielding employee questions or concerns, communication and the interpretation of policies and procedures. He/She will provide counsel to associates and management to maintain a productive and positive work environment, including onboarding and Day 1 new hire activities as well as partner with HR team to effectively manage: associate Leave of Absences, Short-Term Disability, FMLA requests, Workers Compensation issues, OSHA requirements, unemployment claims.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILTIES :
HR Administration : Maintain associate personnel files, serve as I-9 immigration coordinator, track compliance training, provide communications to associates on compliance training
Workday Pro : Serve as Workday Pro to include activities such as Ad Hoc Workday Reporting and associate lifecycle transactions, etc.
Compensation : Benefits/Leave Management, offer development and consultation
Consult with appropriate legal counsel as needed.
Work with HR team and planning teams to organize employee events and other activities such as the annual engagement survey.
Consult with and advise management to maximize employee productivity through timely resolution of issues.

TRAINING:
Ensure all associates and managers are properly trained to use tools and resources related to annual HR processes.
Provide counsel and support to client groups/managers for performance development and improvement. Monitor completion of performance reviews and performance/development planning.

COMPLIANCE:
Monitor all EEO compliance and Affirmative Action programs.
Ensure compliance with all state and federal laws and regulations pertaining to Human Resources matters.
Monitor and provide feedback regarding the use of policies and procedures and propose / draft policies / updates as needed.
Qualifications
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelors degree in Human Resource Management, Business, Organizational Management or comparable discipline, or related field experience preferred.
PHR or SPHR certification is a plus
Oracle knowledge a plus
3 to 5 years of Human Resource Generalist experience.
Knowledge of Federal and State employment laws, Investigation Skills, HR technical knowledge in EEO, AA, FMLA, ADA, unemployment, and worker's compensation

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Strong communications skills: interpersonal, oral and written
Strong ability to work with all levels of associates and management within the organization.
Ability to prioritize workload and self-manage projects, handle multiple tasks and meet strict deadlines.

COMPUTER SKILLS:
Microsoft Office applications: Excel, Power Point, Word, and Outlook.
Workday experience strongly preferred.
Strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills; ability to analyze data.
Human Resource experience should include familiarity with and experience in recruitment, associate relations, associate communications, and leave of absence laws.


Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, dental, environmental and industrial solutions. Our globally diverse team of 59,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $19.9B in revenue last year. We are ranked #144 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 2,000% over 20 years.
At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. title: HUMAN RESOURCES SPECIALIST-Human Resources
description:
The ancestors of the Sycuan Band of the Kumeyaay Nation existed many centuries ago as a community of peoplea Tribe living together, farming, hunting and fishing to survive.

Much has changed since that time. Today the Sycuan Tribe governs its Reservation, owns and operates a Casino and a Golf Resort, and owns a number of other business ventures in the San Diego Region.

One attribute that remains unchanged, however, is Sycuan's sense of community. Sycuan is more than just a business. Sycuan is a community of people working together toward a common goal. Whether you work in our state-of-the-art Casino, our beautiful Resort, or become a staff member in our Tribal Government division, you will be part of the Sycuan family.

Provides Human Resources guidance and support to assigned Casino, Tribal, Resort, and Hotel departments

Ensures paperwork is accurate and in compliance with legal requirements and company policy by advising managers and supervisors on proper and legal application of Human Resources policies and procedures, reviewing performance appraisals and progressive discipline documents for proper completion, initiating corrective action as needed, reviewing termination paperwork for content, clarity and compliance, and providing guidance and direction to Managers on effective use of language in written documents. - 25%

Resolves team member concerns, complaints and issues by meeting with team members, gathering information, working with department managers and supervisors to resolve routine issues and seeking guidance from Employment Manager with sensitive and non-routine situations. - 10%
Assists with the effective delivery of established training programs and onboarding by presenting Sycuans Team Member Handbook during New Team Member Orientation, providing training support in the Interview and Selection class, and answering questions and providing guidance with interpretation of Sycuans policies and procedures. - 5%

title: Human Resources Analyst
description:
$33,435 - $46,624 a yearDEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC SECURITY
Providing Opportunity, Assistance and Care for Arizonans in need!

ARIZONA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (AMS):
All Arizona state employees operate within the Arizona Management System (AMS), an intentional, results-driven approach for doing the work of state government whereby every employee reflects on performance, reduces waste, and commits to continuous improvement with sustainable progress. Through AMS, every state employee seeks to understand customer needs, identify problems, improve processes, and measure results. State employees are highly engaged, collaborative and embrace a culture of public service.
Human Resources Analyst
Office of the Director
1789 W. Jefferson Street
Phoenix, AZ 85007
www.azdes.gov

JOB SUMMARY:
Under the direction of the Human Resources Manager, this position provides general Human Resources administrative support to the areas of recruitment, personnel action requests and classification/compensation.

JOB DUTIES:
 Writes job announcements and creates new requisitions in applicant tracking system. Screens resumes against requirements of the position; prepares hire lists and forwards to hiring manager. Coordinates candidate interviews; conducts reference and background checks and prepares new hire packets. Verifies completion of pre-employment actions and imports documents into OnBase system. Reviews and processes a variety of personnel actions; prepares personnel action forms, resolves any issues or errors and obtains required signatures.
 Maintains, updates and distributes Organizational Charts for Division. Creates weekly reports and attends meeting for HR Manager as needed; takes notes and prepares correspondence. Does preliminary research for ADA accommodations and ergonomic assessments. Updates position descriptions (PDs); handles the reallocation and creation of new PDs as needed; submits to Classification/Compensation and tracks/monitors process through approval. Answers general employee questions and provides technical support to hiring managers as needed.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (KSAs):
Knowledge of:
 DES HR practices, state Personnel Rules and Arizona Department of Administration policies and procedures Employment laws to include FMLA, FLSA and the ADA Human Resource Information Systems (HRIS) and Applicant Tracking Systems Microsoft Office applications  Outlooks, Word, Excel, PowerPoint

Skill in:
 Verbal and written communication Establishing and maintaining effective working relationships Handling sensitive information and maintaining confidentiality Conducting research and interpreting rules, policies and procedures Composing reports, correspondence and proof-reading written documents

Ability to:
 Prioritize, organize and complete projects and tasks Communicate effectively with a wide variety of internal and external customers Establish priorities, coordinate activities and quickly adapt to change

SELECTIVE PREFERENCE(S):
 Three (3) years of experience in Human Resources. One (1) year of administrative-level Human Resources experience or related experience. Experience using Visio to create organization and/or flow charts; experience with Excel, Word, OnBase and HRIS.

PRE-EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS:
 In-state travel may be required. This position requires possession of and ability to retain a current, valid state-issued driver's license appropriate to the assignment. Employees who drive on state business are subject to driver's license record checks, must maintain acceptable driving records and must complete any required driver training (see Arizona Administrative Code R2-10-207.12.). Employees may be required to use their own transportation as well as maintaining valid motor vehicle insurance and current Arizona vehicle registration; however, mileage will be reimbursed. Successfully complete the Electronic Employment Eligibility Verification Program (E-Verify), applicable to all newly hired state employees Successfully pass background and reference checks; employment is contingent upon completion of the above mentioned process and the agencys ability to reasonably accommodate any restrictions.

BENEFITS:
 The Department of Economic Security offers a comprehensive benefits package to include:
 Sick leave Vacation with 10 paid holidays per year Health and dental insurance Retirement plan Life insurance and long-term disability insurance Optional employee benefits include short-term disability insurance, deferred compensation plans, and supplemental life insurance

RETIREMENT:
Positions in this classification participate in the Arizona State Retirement System (ASRS).
Please note, enrollment eligibility will become effective after 27 weeks of employment.

CONTACT US:
If you have any questions please feel free to contact Ruth Ford at 602-771-2910 for assistance.

Persons with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation such as a sign language interpreter or an alternative format by contacting 602-364-3981. Requests should be made as early as possible to allow time to arrange the accommodation. Arizona State Government is an AA/EOE/ADA Reasonable Accommodation Employer.

title: Executive Assistant, Human Resources
description:
Fox News is looking for a proactive and organized Executive Assistant to provide administrative support to the Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) of Fox News Channel and Fox Business Network. The CHRO leads a team who work together as a high-functioning unit. We will rely on you not just to support the CHRO, but also to be an important player who will help strengthen our entire HR team. We need you to be the welcoming and supportive face of the HR department with deep familiarity of all other departments and what they do. We need you to be prompt, work independently, exercise sound judgment and take initiative. In addition to managing all administrative tasks, you will also be tasked with working with sensitive and confidential information.

A SNAPSHOT OF YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage an active calendar of appointments; handle all aspects of business travel and travel agendas; research, prioritize, and follow up on incoming issues and concerns; be an active partner with the CHRO to help him run and manage the department
Build and maintain filing and tracking systems to organize significant amounts of information; handle other sensitive or confidential information; prepare correspondence
Screen incoming calls; prepare and/or review memoranda, correspondence, business updates, meeting notes
Keep tabs on where each member of the HR team is, what s/he is working on, how s/he can be reached
Prioritize conflicting needs; handle matters expeditiously, proactively, and follow-through on projects to successful completion; be able to adapt to fast-changing circumstances

WHAT YOU WILL NEED
4+ years of high-caliber administrative and/or executive assistant experience preferred
Highly organized and detail oriented
Superior time management - ability to prioritize large workloads
Flexible - takes direction with ease
Critical thinking - takes initiative - self-motivated
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Intermediate to advanced skills in MS Office
Positive Can Do attitude


We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.

title: Human Resources Analyst
description:
$6,965 - $9,137 a monthHuman Resources Analyst
#394
San Bernardino, CA
FUNCTIONAL GROUP: Confidential
FULL-TIME/PART-TIME: Full-time
LOCATION CODE: SBCCD Central Services-00003
Posting Closing Date Sep 21, 2018
Work Schedule Monday-Friday 8am-5pm
Job Description
SUMMARY DESCRIPTION:
Under the direction of the appropriate administrator, Human Resources Analyst performs analytical and specialized functions to support the administration of comprehensive human resources and employer/employee relations programs for academic and classified employees; performs related duties as required.
The Human Resources Analyst is the senior classification among support staff positions in the Human Resources Office. Performance of duties requires in-depth knowledge of the organizational structure, risk management, employee safety training programs, District policies, regulations, procedures, union contract provisions, human resources and employer-employee relations processes and practices, legal affairs, resource utilization; worker's compensation, exercise of discretion, and maintenance of confidentiality. Incumbents are assigned a major responsibility in either human resources management or employer-employee relations work, but may be required to perform duties in the alternate area.
The current vacancy will focus on health benefits administration. and leaves of absence administration for the district.
Duties related to health benefits administration includes but not limited to: conducting health benefits workshops, facilitating open enrollment period, coordinating employee health fairs, maintaining and entering data into health benefits eligibility system(s), escalated point of contact for carrier issues, reconciling monthly invoices, and enrolling new hires.
Duties related to leave of absence administration include but not limited to: providing information and to employees and determining employee eligibility on various types of federal, state and collective bargaining agreement leave of absence protections including Family Medical Leave Act (FMLA), California Family Rights Act (CFRA) and Pregnancy Disability Leave (PDL). Tracking of employee leaves and coordinating leaves with Payroll department and employee's supervisor.
REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES:
The following duties are typical for this classification:
1. Provides administrative support in collective bargaining negotiations, contract interpretation, researches, develops, costs-out and analyzes issues and proposals related to the collective bargaining process, participates in collective bargaining negotiation sessions and strategy meetings.
2. Manages the Human Resources Office Records Retention Program, updates and maintains the District's Classification and Compensation Plan.
3. Assists in the review of laws and regulations pertaining to human resources and labor relations activities.
4. Analyzes project costs, and reports effect of proposed and/or established employee contract provisions, policies, programs and activities.
5. Assists in training managers and supervisors in contract implementation, including grievance and disciplinary processes and procedures.
6. Assists in the investigation and response to grievances, unfair labor practice charges, unlawful discrimination claims, and conflict resolution.
7. Facilitates implementation of disciplinary processes, including monitoring timelines and procedures.
8. Monitors processes, timelines, and facilitates work related to employer-employee relations.
9. Coordinates and maintains liability claims administration programs, and acts as liaison with third-party administrators.
10. Monitors due dates, compiles and reports data for State collective bargaining mandated cost reimbursement.
11. Analyzes and explains District policies, contracts, and other regulations.
12. Assists in hiring, representing the Human Resources functions, including participating in employment interviews, conducting pre-employment reference inquiries, orientation, and training processes for new employees.
13. Trains and/or arranges for departmental staff training.
14. Assists in planning and implementing management training and staff development programs.
15. Analyzes jobs, conducts job classification and compensation studies.
16. Drafts policies and procedures.
17. Assists in the administration of salary and benefit programs.
18. Facilitates and coordinates the HRIS programs.
19. Assists in reporting data for Management Information System (MIS).
20. Coordinates faculty and staff diversity programs and regulations, including training representatives and advising selection committees of equal employment.
21. Develops salary, benefit, budget, and other statistical data.
22. Utilizes software programs and recommends modifications conducive to increased efficiency.
23. Communicates effectively orally and in writing.
24. Carries out oral and written direction.
25. Demonstrates a sensitivity to and understanding of the diverse academic, socioeconomic, cultural, and ethnic backgrounds of staff and students and of staff and students with physical and learning disabilities.
26. Performs other related duties as required.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING ENVIRONMENT:
The conditions herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.
Environment: Work is performed primarily in a standard office setting.
Physical: Primary functions require sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in an office setting; to stand or sit for prolonged periods of time; to occasionally stoop, bend, kneel, crouch, reach, and twist; to lift, carry, push, and/or pull light to moderate amounts of weight; to operate office equipment requiring repetitive hand movement and fine coordination including use of a computer keyboard; and to verbally communicate to exchange information.
Vision: See in the normal visual range with or without correction; vision sufficient to read computer screens and printed documents; and to operate assigned equipment.
Hearing: Hear in the normal audio range with or without correction.
Requirements
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education and Experience Guidelines: A typical way to obtain knowledge and abilities would be:
Education/Training:
A Bachelor's degree in public administration, human resources, business administration, paralegal studies or related field. *Completion of at least sixty (60) college-level semester units and six years of human resources administration experience can be used in the absence of a bachelor's degree.

Experience:
Four years of professional experience with increasingly responsibilities in human resources management, employer-employee relations, risk management, basic workers' compensation, including classification compensation benefits, or similar programs involving regulatory processes and procedures.

Unofficial transcripts must be submitted with application. Copies of diploma will not be accepted.

Experience must be indicated in the application. Resumes will not be used for screening of minimum qualifications.

Desirable Qualifications:
Experience in a public agency preferably in the California Community College system.

Special Condition:
Positions in this classification may be required to work varied hours according to need.

Other Employment Requirements:
Live Scan and Proof of Tuberculosis clearance required for employment at employee expense.

The following generally describes the knowledge and ability required to enter the job and/or be learned within a short period of time in order to successfully perform the assigned duties.

Knowledge of:
Human Resources and/or employer-employee relations programs and processes.
Current relevant federal and state laws and regulations related to Human Resources.
Laws and regulations related to risk management, loss control, workers' compensation programs and workplace safety issues.
Information sources and resource materials available to California Community Colleges.
Arithmetic to compute salary, benefit, and budget data.
Collection and organization of data.
Equal Employment Opportunity guidelines.
Research methodologies appropriate for human resources functions.
Job analysis methodologies and application.
English, grammar, spelling, and punctuation.

REQUIRED Supporting Documents:
Cover Letter
Resume
Unofficial Transcripts

APPLICATIONS SUBMITTED WITHOUT THE REQUIRED SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS WILL BE DEEMED INCOMPLETE AND NOT FORWARDED FOR CONSIDERATION

title: 2019 Human Resources Internships
description:
Job Description:

Real projects. Real impact.
Are you ready for a challenge that could launch your career? T-Mobile is revolutionizing the wireless industry for millions of customers nationwide. Working here means rolling up your sleeves and disrupting the status quo with a team that has your back every step of the way.

Youre invited to be an Intern with our Human Resources Team.

This is a 12-week paid learning experience with our team responsible for supporting all of our 50K employees. From compensation, payroll, benefits and career development to employee discounts, rewards and recognition or recruiting the best-of-the-best, weve got our employees covered.

Whether its from our headquarters campus in Bellevue, WA or from one of our regional business offices across the country, we work hard to keep our employees happy and motivated members of Team Magenta. We help take care of the things that matter most to our employees and their families so they can do what T-Mobile does best: focus on our customers.

Responsibilities:

Working as an Intern on our Human Resources Team means everything from crunching numbers around compensation research and bench-marking, building out our employer brand and working with our employee network groups to evaluating the effectiveness of current development program and processes, supporting key HR initiatives and training design and implementation.

Youll contribute your creativity and great ideas, working alongside innovative colleagues and mentors who will push you to be your very best. Well give you hands-on projects and the chance to make an immediate impact. We're anticipating six roles this year. Here are some of the roles you could have as an Intern with our Human Resources Team
Compensation Analyst
Diversity & Inclusion Coordinator
Employer Brand
HR Generalist
Instructional Design
Learning & Development
Workforce Planning Analyst

Qualifications
Youre currently enrolled in college and pursuing a Bachelors, Masters, or MBA degree with a Business, Comms, Data Management, Human Resources, or Industrial Relations focus.
Youre a self-starter with a passion for learning who is not afraid to ask questions.
Things change and move pretty fast on this team and your ability to quickly adapt, change direction and think on your feet without missing a beat is essential.
You share our Un-carrier spirit. This is about breaking rules, paving our own path and making things better for our customers  and each other.
Qualifications:

Being an Intern
Our Internship Program takes place over the summer running 12 weeks from June to September. As an Intern, youll receive competitive pay, relocation benefits, a world class learning experience, and the support of a team that believes in your potential. Youll also have plenty of opportunities to meet and network with other interns, fellow team members, and top leaders from all business functions across the company as you make connections that will last your career. Want to learn more?


A big part of our culture is about embracing our Magenta spirit. And well ask you to do the same. Check out #BeMagenta to see how we work together to take care of our customers and each other every day.

Recruiting Timeline
Recruiting for the 2019 internship program takes place from September 2018 through March 2019. Well be visiting campuses across the country and attending national recruiting conferences in September through November. Well be connecting with candidates and begin screening in January. If we think youre a good fit for one of our roles, well contact you directly to discuss next steps. Interviews will start to take place in late January and all internships will be filled by the end of March.

Application Process
Select the job category that best matches your interests, education and experience and click apply. Well then review your application. If we think youre a good fit for one of our roles, well contact you directly to discuss next steps.

Minimum Qualifications:

At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED

As Americas Un-carrier, T-Mobile US, Inc. (NASDAQ: TMUS) is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The companys advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile US provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and MetroPCS. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com
