title: 2019 Human Resources Internships
description:
Job Description:

Real projects. Real impact.
Are you ready for a challenge that could launch your career? T-Mobile is revolutionizing the wireless industry for millions of customers nationwide. Working here means rolling up your sleeves and disrupting the status quo with a team that has your back every step of the way.

Youre invited to be an Intern with our Human Resources Team.

This is a 12-week paid learning experience with our team responsible for supporting all of our 50K employees. From compensation, payroll, benefits and career development to employee discounts, rewards and recognition or recruiting the best-of-the-best, weve got our employees covered.

Whether its from our headquarters campus in Bellevue, WA or from one of our regional business offices across the country, we work hard to keep our employees happy and motivated members of Team Magenta. We help take care of the things that matter most to our employees and their families so they can do what T-Mobile does best: focus on our customers.

Responsibilities:

Working as an Intern on our Human Resources Team means everything from crunching numbers around compensation research and bench-marking, building out our employer brand and working with our employee network groups to evaluating the effectiveness of current development program and processes, supporting key HR initiatives and training design and implementation.

Youll contribute your creativity and great ideas, working alongside innovative colleagues and mentors who will push you to be your very best. Well give you hands-on projects and the chance to make an immediate impact. We're anticipating six roles this year. Here are some of the roles you could have as an Intern with our Human Resources Team
Compensation Analyst
Diversity & Inclusion Coordinator
Employer Brand
HR Generalist
Instructional Design
Learning & Development
Workforce Planning Analyst

Qualifications
Youre currently enrolled in college and pursuing a Bachelors, Masters, or MBA degree with a Business, Comms, Data Management, Human Resources, or Industrial Relations focus.
Youre a self-starter with a passion for learning who is not afraid to ask questions.
Things change and move pretty fast on this team and your ability to quickly adapt, change direction and think on your feet without missing a beat is essential.
You share our Un-carrier spirit. This is about breaking rules, paving our own path and making things better for our customers  and each other.
Qualifications:

Being an Intern
Our Internship Program takes place over the summer running 12 weeks from June to September. As an Intern, youll receive competitive pay, relocation benefits, a world class learning experience, and the support of a team that believes in your potential. Youll also have plenty of opportunities to meet and network with other interns, fellow team members, and top leaders from all business functions across the company as you make connections that will last your career. Want to learn more?


A big part of our culture is about embracing our Magenta spirit. And well ask you to do the same. Check out #BeMagenta to see how we work together to take care of our customers and each other every day.

Recruiting Timeline
Recruiting for the 2019 internship program takes place from September 2018 through March 2019. Well be visiting campuses across the country and attending national recruiting conferences in September through November. Well be connecting with candidates and begin screening in January. If we think youre a good fit for one of our roles, well contact you directly to discuss next steps. Interviews will start to take place in late January and all internships will be filled by the end of March.

Application Process
Select the job category that best matches your interests, education and experience and click apply. Well then review your application. If we think youre a good fit for one of our roles, well contact you directly to discuss next steps.

Minimum Qualifications:

At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED
Pre-employment background screen
Currently enrolled in a college or university or post-graduation of 12 months
Company Profile:

As Americas Un-carrier, T-Mobile US, Inc. (NASDAQ: TMUS) is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The companys advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile US provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and MetroPCS. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com

EOE Statement:

We Take Equal Opportunity Seriously - By Choice

T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with our Company values and will not be tolerated. Furthermore, such discrimination or harassment may violate federal, state, or local law.

title: Human Resources Administrator/Sr. Human Resources Administrator
description:
Temporary, ContractMAJOR FUNCTIONS:

Provides general human resources support for the division. Performs advanced, diversified and confidential duties requiring broad and comprehensive administrative experience. Administers employee benefits, attendance policies and leaves of absences. Responsible for SAP changes, input and reports, payroll and payroll processing, monitoring Kronos time and attendance transactions and assisting in the talent acquisition and onboarding processes. Interfaces with employees at all levels, answers questions and directs employees to information, policies and practices when necessary.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provides information on company policies, benefits, conducts new hire orientation, manages the onboarding process and interfaces regularly with employees and supervisors. Directs employees as necessary to the SAM page for company information.
Processes weekly and semi-monthly payroll in partnership with corporate payroll for 150-200 employees.
Responsible for the management of temporary and contract workforce. Works with staffing partners and supervisors to fill temporary and contract positions. Provides support to supervisors regarding the usage of agency employees and tracking of temporary hours worked.
Provides specialized staff work to coordinate leaves of absences, safety accident and injury program.
May conduct research on employment laws pertaining to terminations, sick leave etc. to ensure compliance and that personnel policies and practices are current and support business objectives.
Utilizes SAP database and Kronos timekeeping database for day-to-day transactions and maintenance of employee records. Manages all employee files and documentation records for compliance and confidentiality as required by law and company policies (I-9s, EEO data, LOAs, Medical information, etc.)
Provides information regarding benefit changes and new enrollments to the appropriate insurance carriers. Ensures the accuracy of enrolled members information.
Plans, organizes, and implements reward and recognition programs consistent with corporate culture and philosophy.
Ensures compliance with local, state, and federal Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) rules and regulations, investigating accidents and injuries, ensuring employees receive medical treatment as needed, coordinate with company third party administrator on employee injuries and completion of OSHA reports.
Maintains transaction logs such as new hire, transfers, promotions, demotions, terminations, layoffs in accordance and compliance with OFCCP/EEOC requirements.
Counsels and coaches employees, supervisors and managers in addressing issues related to employee changes, leaves of absence, FMLA, payroll, attendance policy, benefits, etc.
Facilitates employee relations and morale by coordinating company events and gatherings. Including but not limited to Owners Days, United Way Fundraising and corporate initiatives.
Performs other required duties as needed in addition to the essential duties and responsibilities described above.



JOB DIMENSIONS:

Receives work direction from Human Resources Manager/Director, or other designated leader. Works under general supervision, conferring with supervisor on unusual matters. Works closely with all levels of employees in areas of assigned responsibility. Maintains technical and professional knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications and participating in professional organizations.


Required Skills

Required Experience
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE:

SG 05 - Human Resources Administrator 3+ years of administrative experience with at least one year within a human resources function.

SG 06 - Sr. Human Resources Administrator 6+ years of administrative experience with at least three years within a human resources function.

Associate degree in Business, or related field desired. 2 - 3 years of directly related experience may be substituted for the degree requirement. Demonstrated ability to interface well with all levels of employees and have strong customer service skills. Strong written and oral communication skills is necessary to write effective communications to business partners and communicate orally and in writing with employees and corporate counterparts regarding organizational matters. Proficiency with the use of HRIS systems, MS Office, including Word, Excel and Outlook and other commonly used business software is required.

full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree.

To calculate, first identify the percentage of required education you have earned (when substituting, you cannot use the first 60 semester hours that you earned). Then identify the percentage of required experience you possess. Add the two percentages. The total percentage must equal at least 100 percent to qualify at the GS-XX. For example, an applicant who has 9 semester hours of graduate level education (i.e. 50% of graduate education required) and 6 months of creditable specialized experience (i.e. 50% of the required experience) would equal 100% of the required experience for the position A transcript must be submitted with your application if you are basing all or part of your qualifications on education.
